item.title: Leading Through Service and Empathy: Rethinking Technical Leadership
item.description:
Introduction

The evolution of the technology sector has fundamentally transformed the nature of leadership. In environments characterized by complexity, interdependence, and rapid innovation, traditional hierarchical models centred on control and authority are no longer sufficient. Contemporary organizations require leadership approaches that integrate both human and technical dimensions to sustain performance, resilience, and innovation.

item.title: Leading Through Service and Empathy: Rethinking Technical Leadership
item.description:
Introduction

In contemporary organizations, technology has become a strategic determinant of competitiveness, adaptability, and value creation. As such, every technical decision carries implications that extend beyond engineering performance into business continuity, scalability, and long-term sustainability.

item.title: How to Effect Long-Lasting Organizational Changes
item.description:
Change is hard.

Sometimes it’s unavoidable in life and organizations. Take remote work: not long ago, many companies dismissed it outright. Today, they are drafting work-from-home policies they never thought they would need.

Change will happen with or without us. The real question is: what makes it last?

item.title: What is a Social Entrepreneur?
item.description:
Today, social entrepreneurship is defined in many ways. This ambiguity can blur the identity of social entrepreneurs, undermine their credibility, weaken the relevance of the guidance they receive, and ultimately hinder their impact. That is why a shared definition is essential.

This article presents my perspective and insights on social entrepreneurs, based on primary research conducted with a small random sample in Toronto, Canada.
